key_risks: Regulatory and compliance risks, including Medicare and Medicaid billing scrutiny
High debt burden with a net debt-to-equity ratio of 62.9% and net debt-to-EBITDA ratio of 4.1x
Intense competition from other ambulatory surgery center operators and hospital systems
Potential disruptions in elective surgeries due to macroeconomic uncertainties or pandemics
controversies: $41 million settlement in 2020 for unnecessary urine drug testing services
Past allegations of fraudulent billing practices
social_issues: Reliance on physician partnerships and payor relationships, which could be disrupted by legal or ethical lapses
governance_issues: Past legal issues and fraud settlements damaging reputation and inviting further regulatory scrutiny
Dependence on a robust Compliance and Ethics Program to navigate evolving healthcare regulations
